description: A 47-year-old male presents with a tender, well-defined ulceration of the left ventral tongue of 2 weeks duration.
label: Diagnosis: Erosive lichen planus

description: A 31 year old female noticed a flat grey/black asymptomatic alteration in the anterior floor of her mouth, of unknown duration.
label: Diagnosis: Amalgam tattoo

description: A bilaterally symmetrical ulcerative process noted by this 41-year-old female, present for several months. The patient is a non-smoker and uses no alcohol.
label: Diagnosis: Squamous cell carcinoma

description: An elderly woman with advanced sun-induced degenerative alterations of face and lips. Presented with midline ulcerated mass.
label: Diagnosis: Squamous cell carcinoma, arising actinic cheilitis

description: A 59-year-old female with a painless papillary mass of the left posterior mandibular alveolar ridge.
label: Diagnosis: Verrucous carcinoma

description: A 38-year-old a male presented with a white friable lesion of the maxillary gingiva which wiped off with a cotton swab, leaving a raw red base.
label: Diagnosis: Aspirin Burn

description: 64-year-old male with a long history of cigarette smoking presents with an asymmetrical nodular mass in the retromolar region.
label: Diagnosis: Squamous cell carcinoma, nodular/exothytic

description: The patient is a 64-year-old male with granular nodular partially ulcerated mass of the anterior mandibular gingiva.
label: Diagnosis: Squamous cell carcinoma

description: On a routine examination of a 52-year-old female a well defined red velvety lesion of the lower-left ventral tongue was observed.
label: Clinical Diagnosis: Erythroplakia Microscopic | Diagnosis: Squamous cell carcinoma

description: Red and white surface alteration which is centrally indurated/firm was noted on routine examination in this 70-year-old male. The patient has a long time history of tobacco and alcohol abuse.
label: Diagnosis: Squamous cell carcinoma

description: The patient has a white lesion with irregular margins on the left ventral tongue. At the inferior aspect, there is a prominent red patch of tissue.
label: Diagnosis: Carcinoma in situ

description: An 8-year-old child evaluated for the superficial, ulcerated, irregular lesion.
label: Diagnosis: Tramatic ulcer (facticious)

description: Blood-based, firm, asymptomatic nodule of long duration was noted along the right buccal mucosa during routine examination.
label: Diagnosis: Irritational fibroma

description: Slightly elevated crater form and firm asymmetrical lesion were found on routine oral examination of the left lateral soft palette.
label: Diagnosis: Squamous cell carcinoma

description: This 46-year-old female presents with irregular ulceration of the ventral lateral tongue, which is surrounded by leukoplakia.
label: Diagnosis Edge biopsy revealed squamous cell carcinoma

description: A 69-year female presented with a sharply defined palatal ulceration.
label: Diagnosis: Squamous cell carcinoma

description: A 48-year-old female presents with a hard gingival swelling that on X-ray consisted of dense bone which was contiguous with the cortex.
label: Diagnosis: Osteoma

description: A flat, painless lesion of the mid-third of the tongue, showed sharply defined borders. This lesion was noted subsequent to a long course of antibiotic therapy.
label: Diagnosis: Median rhomboid glossitis

description: This ulceration of the buccal mucosa was noticed during a routine oral examination after a dental extraction.
label: Diagnosis: Traumatic ulcer

description: A 55-year-old male noted loosening of the lower incisors. On exam, a granular to warty mass was noted on the gingiva extending into the labial fold.
label: Diagnosis: Well-differentiated squamous cell carcinoma

description: An elongated, heterogeneous, red, well-defined ulceration was observed on the left lateral aspect of the tongue of a 48-year-old male.
label: Diagnosis: Biopsy at several locations revealed dysplasia and carcinoma in situ.

description: In this patient, the anterior floor of the mouth, bilateral to the midline, demonstrated a vaguely marginated lesion, which was firm on palpation.
label: Diagnosis: Marginally invasive squamous cell carcinoma

description: In this patient, the buccal mucosa bilaterally showed red and white surface changes, with delicate keratotic striae enclosing a thin, but intact red area.
label: Diagnosis: Lichen Planus

description: A densely papillary, white, exothitic mass with posterior ulceration was noted on the mandibular gingiva of this 72 year old male with a 55 pack/year history of cigarette smoking and heavy alcohol consumption.
label: Diagnosis: Papillary squamous cell carcinoma

description: The right lateral tongue of this patient demonstrated the presence of an indurated, painless ulcer of unknown duration.
label: Diagnosis: Early-stage squamous cell carcinoma

description: A 78-year-old female was evaluated for multiple macular pigmented lesions of the floor of the mouth and attached gingiva.
label: Diagnosis: Malignant melanoma

description: A 68 year old female presented with a slightly white nodular alteration of the retromolar region.
label: Diagnosis: Squamous cell carcinoma

description: A 78 year old woman with a long history of tobacco and alcohol abuse, has difficulty opening her mouth. Examination revealed a foul smelling lesion extending superiorly and to the posterior.
label: Diagnosis: Squamous cell carcinoma

description: A bluish-red nodular mass was detected in the maxillary right quadrant of this 54 year old male.
label: Diagnosis: Peripheral giant cell granuloma
